ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- cos6
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-cos7-x86_64
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '7'
libblas:
- 3.9 *netlib
liblapack:
- 3.9 *netlib
netcdf_fortran:
- '4.5'
pin_run_as_build:
  netcdf-fortran:
    max_pin: x.x
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
SUMMA is a hydrologic modeling framework that can be used for the
systematic analysis of alternative model conceptualizations with
respect to flux parameterizations, spatial configurations, and numerical
solution techniques. It can be used to configure a wide range of
hydrological model alternatives and we anticipate that systematic model
analysis will help researchers and practitioners understand reasons
for inter-model differences in model behavior.

SUMMA is a hydrologic modeling framework that can be used for the
systematic analysis of alternative model conceptualizations with
respect to flux parameterizations, spatial configurations, and numerical
solution techniques. It can be used to configure a wide range of
hydrological model alternatives and we anticipate that systematic model
analysis will help researchers and practitioners understand reasons
for inter-model differences in model behavior.

name: summa

about.description:
SUMMA is a hydrologic modeling framework that can be used for the
systematic analysis of alternative model conceptualizations with
respect to flux parameterizations, spatial configurations, and numerical
solution techniques. It can be used to configure a wide range of
hydrological model alternatives and we anticipate that systematic model
analysis will help researchers and practitioners understand reasons
for inter-model differences in model behavior.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "3.1.0" %}

package:
  name: summa
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  git_url: https://github.com/ncar/summa.git
  git_rev: v{{ version }}
  git_depth: -1 # (Defaults to -1/not shallow)

build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - liblapack
    - libblas
    - netcdf-fortran
    - make
  host:
    - liblapack
    - libblas
    - netcdf-fortran
  run:
    - liblapack
    - libblas
    - netcdf-fortran
    
test:
  commands:
    - summa.exe --help
    
about:
  home: http://github.com/ncar/summa
  license:  GPL-3.0-or-later
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: "Hydrologic modeling framework"

  description: |
    SUMMA is a hydrologic modeling framework that can be used for the
    systematic analysis of alternative model conceptualizations with
    respect to flux parameterizations, spatial configurations, and numerical
    solution techniques. It can be used to configure a wide range of
    hydrological model alternatives and we anticipate that systematic model
    analysis will help researchers and practitioners understand reasons
    for inter-model differences in model behavior.
  doc_url: http://summa.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/ncar/summa

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - bartnijssen
    - arbennett
